'Lomonosov Moscow State University' (, MoskÃ³vskiy gosudÃ¡rstvennyy universitÃ©t
Ã­meni M. V. LomonÃ³sova), previously known as 'Lomonosov University' or 'MSU' (,
UniversitÃ©t LomonÃ³sova; , MGU), is the oldest and largest university in Russia.
Founded in 1755, the university was renamed in honor of its founder, Mikhail
Lomonosov, in 1940. It also claims to have the tallest educational building in
the world. Its current rector is Viktor Sadovnichiy.
categories: Buildings and structures built in the Soviet Union
